item.title: Chocolate Orange Marble Cake
item.description: This moist and visually stunning Chocolate Orange Marble Cake combines the rich depth of unsweetened chocolate with the bright zestiness of fresh orange. Perfect for brunch or dessert, it’s a delightful treat that balances citrus and cocoa flavors in a tender, fluffy cake.
item.dc:creator: author_003
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 50 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 65 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 12

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 cup butter
  • 1 1/4 cups white sugar
  • 3 eggs
  • 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
  • 1 cup plain yogurt
  • 1 3/4 cups all-purpose flour
  • 3/4 teaspoon baking soda
  • 3/4 teaspoon baking powder
  • 1/4 teaspoon salt
  • 2 tablespoons grated orange zest
  • 2 (1 ounce) squares unsweetened chocolate, melted
  • 2 tablespoons orange liqueur
  • 2 tablespoons orange juice
  • 1/4 cup white sugar (for glaze)

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour one 10-inch tube pan.
  2. In a large bowl, cream the butter with 1 cup of the white sugar until light and fluffy.
  3. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then add vanilla extract and yogurt, mixing well.
  4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.
  5. Gradually beat the dry ingredients into the creamed mixture until just combined.
  6. Divide the batter evenly into two bowls.
  7. Stir the orange zest into one bowl of batter.
  8. Add the melted chocolate to the other bowl and mix thoroughly.
  9. Alternately spoon the orange and chocolate batters into the prepared tube pan.
  10. Use a knife to swirl through the batters to create a marbled effect.
  11. Bake for 50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
  12. While the cake is baking, mix the remaining 1/4 cup sugar, orange juice, and orange liqueur to make the glaze.
  13. As soon as the cake is removed from the oven, pour the glaze evenly over the hot cake.
  14. Allow the cake to cool completely on a wire rack before removing from the pan and serving.
